pullRequest.title: Handle SocketTimeoutExceptions in LDAP and Proxy Disclosure Scan Rules
pullRequest.bodyText:
Addressed STEs encountered in specific locations in these two scan rules.
Added Fix note to the CHANGELOGs.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure what issue this is addressing. Instead of sending originalmsg (which is actually the message passed into the scan method) should this simply leverage getBaseMsg() and not resend the msg being passed in?
Should it return? If there's no response there's nothing to check?

commit.message:
Handle SocketTimeoutExceptions in LDAP and Proxy Disclosure Scan Rules

- Addressed STEs encountered in specific locations in these two scan
rules.
- Added Fix note to the CHANGELOGs.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: I may be missing something, but I can't see a SocketTimeoutException being handled in the LDAP Injection scan rule?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,8 @@ The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).
